spamfilter module¶

class spamfilter.Spamfilter(training_dir)¶

Bases: object

A naive Bayesian spam filter

Methods

classify(self, filepath)

classifies a file as spam or ham based on training data

classify_all(self, dir_path[, known_type])

Classifies all emails in a testing directory and maintains count of errors

clean_table(self, min_freq)

Removes entries from frequency table if they are deemed poor indicators.

create_frequency_table(self)

Generates token frequency table from training emails :return: dict{k,v}: spam/ham frequencies k = (str)token, v = {spam_freq: , ham_freq:, prob_spam:, prob_ham:}

print_table_info(self)

Print training info: - unique tokens in ham and spam, number of emails in training set

prob_ham(self, token)

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in ham emails

Calculates the probability that a message is ham

Calculates the probability that a message is spam

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in spam emails
classify(self, filepath)¶

classifies a file as spam or ham based on training data

Parameters

filepath –

Returns

(boolean) True->spam, False->ham

classify_all(self, dir_path, known_type='spam')¶

Classifies all emails in a testing directory and maintains count of errors

Parameters

  • dir_path – path of testing directory

  • known_type – str: the known type of testing directory

clean_table(self, min_freq)¶

Removes entries from frequency table if they are deemed poor indicators. or if combined spam/ham frequency is below ‘min_freq’

Parameters

min_freq – if total token count below threshold, delete from table

create_frequency_table(self)¶

Generates token frequency table from training emails :return: dict{k,v}: spam/ham frequencies k = (str)token, v = {spam_freq: , ham_freq:, prob_spam:, prob_ham:}

print_table_info(self)¶

Print training info: - unique tokens in ham and spam, number of emails in training set

prob_ham(self, token)¶

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in ham emails

Parameters

token – (str)

Returns

(float) probability ‘token’ is ham based on training emails

prob_msg_ham(self, filepath)¶

Calculates the probability that a message is ham

Parameters

filepath – (str) path of email

Returns

(float) probability message is ham

prob_msg_spam(self, filepath)¶

Calculates the probability that a message is spam

Parameters

filepath – (str) path of email

Returns

(float) probability message is spam

prob_spam(self, token)¶

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in spam emails

Parameters

token – (str)

Returns

(float) probability ‘token’ is spam based on training emails

spamfilter.clean_split(in_str)¶

Removes all non-alphanum chars and splits string at whitespace, downcase

Parameters

in_str – (str) target string

Returns

(list) cleaned strings

spamfilter.dir_tokens(dir_path)¶

tokenizes all files contained in ‘dir_path’

Parameters

dir_path – directory containing files to be tokenized

Returns

list of tokens

spamfilter.file_tokens(filepath)¶

tokenizes all strings contained in ‘filepath’ after removing all non-alphanum chars and splitting strings at whitespace

Parameters

filepath – path of target file

Returns

list of tokens

spamfilter.tokens(text, tok_size=3)¶

Returns a list of all substrings contained in ‘text’ of size ‘tok_size’

Parameters

  • text – (string) text to tokenize

  • tok_size – length of substrings

Returns

(list) tokens of ‘text’
